title: Voting rules on who can vote

content.prompt: In the United States, which of the following is a rule on voting found in the Constitution or its amendments?

choices.label: No person may be denied the right to vote merely for lack of either state or federal citizenship.
No person eighteen years of age or older may be denied the right to vote on account of age.
No person may be denied the right to vote merely because he or she has previously served a prison sentence.
A state may not establish a residency requirement for voting.
A state may require a person to pay a poll tax in order to register to vote.
